body:
That is a bug - well spotted.

Can you try this fix please?

[v1.55.0-beta.5176.22a7c5cde.fix-5019-bwlimit](https://beta.rclone.org/branch/fix-5019-bwlimit/v1.55.0-beta.5176.22a7c5cde.fix-5019-bwlimit/) on branch [fix-5019-bwlimit](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/tree/fix-5019-bwlimit) (uploaded in 15-30 mins)

If that works for you I'll put it in the v1.54.1 point release.
Thank you, i Shall try it tomorrow!
It seems to be working well, thank you! Files start playing as fast as they used to, there is no buffering and the upload rate is still limited.

Thanks for testing.

I've merged this to master now which means it will be in [the latest beta](https://beta.rclone.org) in 15-30 mins and released in v1.54.1

I think that something in that branche has caused memory errors again. After a few hours the error log shows a long list of memory errors and the mount has disappeared from windows explorer.

I have changed nothing else than changing from 1.54 to that beta branch.

What sort of memory errors? Can you paste a log please?

I'll re-open this

It has these kinds of errors. I have now seperated it again into 2 instances. One for uploading and one for downloading and that has been stable for 2 days. 

The only thing that i can't do now is having plex scan for recent changes. As it has to be mounted on 2 different drive letters unfortunately.

That backtrace is missing the start which tells what happens. I'm guessing it was an out of memory error?

The usual reason for out of memory error is this `--buffer-size=512M` - rclone will use 0.5G of memory per open file! I suggest you remove the setting (the default is 16M which is usually enough).

@LeendertPlas
Could you send the trace again?
It's pretty big and github loses it's start
Could you send it as a file?
You can drag-n-drop files to the bottom of a comment here, or via https://gist.github.com or using pastebin etc.
We need this data to resolve your issue.
Thanks!

Hello, i don't have the logs anymore but i have since upgraded my pc to have significantly more RAM (from 16 to 48), so this has solved the problem anyway. I have also split my mounts up to have 2 read-only mounts and 5 upload mounts. I removed the buffer-size parameter from the upload mounts and changed the buffer-size paramater to a higher size on the read-only mounts. It is currentle 1024MB, but i don't know if this has sped anything up as i don't know how to test this. Responsiveness feels fast.

While memory usage is still high, it is not a problem anymore. As i have so many mounts, it is difficult to see which one has a high memory usage. My largest one has a memory usage of 7 GB. I think that this is a mount that is currently uploading things. That does seem high, but i don't know enough to be able to say if that is too much as i have a lot of RAM left over.

Thank you for reporting @LeendertPlas 

So the original issue was solved by a patch which is now on master, the high memory usage - by a RAM upgrade.

Closing as resolved :-)
